alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 3:52PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Graham, northeastern Cochise and southeastern Greenlee Counties through 430 PM MST... At 351 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Bowie, or 19 miles northeast of Willcox, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Willcox, Bowie, Chiricahua National Monument, Duncan, Franklin, San Simon and Kansas Settlement. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 339 and 391. Route 70 between mile markers 378 and 385. Route 75 between mile markers 379 and 380. Route 181 between mile markers 61 and 64. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 359. Route 191 between mile markers 88 and 103. Route 266 between mile markers 106 and 111. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
